title: Walking Through Each Choice
text: $$x̄_A$$ - $$x̄_B$$ $$=$$ difference in the sample means (also known as the random variable) \\n P-value $$=$$ how likely the data occurred under the null hypothesis \\n $$t_{df}$$ $$=$$ distribution for the test

title: Distribution
text: Which of the following solves for the distribution of the test: Student's t, p-value, or $$x̄_A$$ - $$x̄_B$$?
